name: 盧大平
objective: This course intends to introduce essential topics regarding supply chain and logistic management. Supply chain management is an integrated approach to manage the total flow of manufacturing and distribution channel from supplier to ultimate customer. The contents of this course include the development of supply chain management concept and strategies, logistic management, supply chain management functions, supply chain management performance evaluation, and major challenges of supply chain management. Certain topics related to supply chain management, such as inventory control policy, information system integration, and supply contract will also be addresses. This course focuses on both theoretical and practical issues. Real world case study will be an important part of this course.
schedule:
Week 1-2: Supply Chain Management Concept and Overview
Week 3-4: The Evolution of Supply Chain Management
Week 5-6: Major Functions in Supply Chain Management
Week 7-8: Major Challenges in Supply Chain Management
Week 9-10: Inventory Management
Week 11-12: Hands-on Case Practice 
Week 13-14: Supply Chain Integration – Supply contracts
Week 15-16: Information Technology and Business Processes
Week 17-18: Real World Case studies
scorePolicy:
1.　　Hands-on Case Practice 30%
2.　　Final Project 30%
3.　　Homework and Casework 20%
4.　　Class Participation – (Think and Discuss) 20%
materials: Text book: Design and Managing the Supply Chain: concepts, Strategies and Case Studies. Simchi-Levi/Kaminsky, third Edition, McGraw Hill
